website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic DMP-BD30 offers excellent video quality and is Blu-ray Profile 1.1 compliant, but those who want high-resolution audio will need a cutting-edge AV receiver.
pros: Excellent picture quality on Blu-ray discs
can output Dolby TrueHD and DTS-HD Master Audio in bitstream format
SD card slot can play high-def video from AVCHD camcorders
cons: No built-in decoding for high-resolution audio formats
no Ethernet jack for firmware upgrades or future interactive content

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Panasonic - player will only last until warranty expires.
customer_reviews.text: AVOID THIS PLAYER I have had this player for several years, with no problems. Recently connected it to the internet and updated the firmware. Now, a bluray movie it played flawlessly 2 days ago will not play, nor will any bluray disk. Standard DVDs play fine, but firmware has locked out all blurays. Programmed obsolescence - Stay away from Panasonic and consider any other brand that does not force you to buy a new player through firmware shenanigans. You'll be sorry !!
customer_reviews.author: Mayor McCheese

customer_reviews.title: Not impressive, will be looking elsewhere for electronics...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device and was never satisfied with it. Firstly, it was very expensive (>$400). The biggest initial issue was it was extremely slow loading BlueRay discs. Overtime, it stopped loading them completely (i assumed because the firmware was defective). So I tried updating the firmware. Whomever came up with the update procedure should be forced to provide on-line customer service for this POS unit as punishment. FYI, the techs who do actually handle support aren't PhDs either. This is the second Panasonic device that I am unhappy with which surprised me as I thought they had a good reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N. Crouse

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: The pros: Works well, gets up and running reasonably quickly, I think (no other BD player to compare that with), good remote. Compared with the older Panasonic multi-disc DVD player I have it seems to upscale DVDs to 1080i more effectively. The cons: No controls on the box itself other than power and eject. I've got lots of photos I'd like to load to CD/DVD (eventually Blu-ray) to display on the HD TV, but I can never seem to find the right combination of settings with the DVD burner so the data CD/DVD actually works in the Blu-ray player or so the photos display. (Had the same problem with the DVD player.) It does fine with video DVDs, though.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Brink

customer_reviews.title: Operates as designed
customer_reviews.text: Great player, great price. I fail to see why a person would spend more. I watched Wall-e and Tropic Thunder on my 60" Sony KDS2000 in full 1080p - what can can I say - it blows you away. The picture quality is beautiful. The sound through my Pioneer 1018 Receiver is also incredible. The player operates without a glitch and synced seamlessly with my other components. Load time, though I didn't time it - was certainly reasonable. My first venture into Bluray and I'm going to find it difficult to ever watch or listen to a movie in another format. Good stuff. As a bonus, it came double boxed in a flawless shipping carton. Love Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Cartman

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this
customer_reviews.text: I had a very old DVD player and hadn't experienced "upconverting" before. Even your plain old-school DVDs will look much better on this machine and Blu-ray discs look very, very good. I'm not maxing this thing out by any means (50" 720p plasma and 2-channel audio thru a 1st-generation Bose 3-2-1) but the difference vs. my old player is dramatic. Cnet convinced me to buy this model; you might want to check out their review. And Netflix only added $1 more per month to add Blu-ray to my account, so I'm renting lots of movies I've seen before to check out what they look like now. Great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent player-solid performanance!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this player since January'08 and absolutely love it! If you are looking for a standalone player to primarily watch movies, with all of the sound processing capabilities you could ask for, and the stability to play all BD's, this one is it. This receives excellent reviews across the board. I own several hi-def and regular DVD players, and with the current price tag, you cannot go wrong. I own over 350 hi-def movies and have never had a problem. Easy updates for firmware, too. Excellent value, quality company. Do not hesitate to purchase this player.
customer_reviews.author: skywatcher

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice BD Player
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an LG player which for some reason made high-pitched whirring noises off-and-on while playing a disc. No noise whatsoever from the Panasonic, so no distractions while watching movies. The remote key layout on the Panasonic is also more straight-forward. Both players take a while to recognize a disc, but that seems to be an issue with all BD players. Finally, the Panasonic recognized and played DVD-R recordings the LG wouldn't. Although this model is no longer manufactured, it is available via the refurb market and a great value for under $200.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product a few weeks ago after deciding the format war was definitely tipping toward Blu-Ray. We could not be happier with it. After just completing a dedicated theater room, we added this player. I did a lot a research on the different models available and could not be happier that I chose the Panasonic. It is easy to use and has a GREAT picutre. We use it with a Sony VPL-VW60 projector through an Onkyo SR805 receiver and it is an awsome system. You will absolutely love the quality and detail this Blu-Ray player provides. Well worth the money -- you will not be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Don L.

customer_reviews.title: Top Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player and connected through CAT6 to update the latest firmware. The firmware update was very simply and easy. I run this player through ONKYO receiver TX-NR906 and Panasonic 58" 1080p TV and Klipsch THX surround speakers. I was amazed to see the picture quality in 1080p and the lossless sound from DTS Master Audio feature. I love the sound that comes through the DVD Player, particularly playing DTS Master Audio Blu-Ray DVD (Die Another Day). I have connected through HDMI with 7.1 speaker configuration. I love this Blu-Ray player. Overall I am a very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Motilal Singh

customer_reviews.title: What good is a ZOOM if you can't enlarge 4x3
customer_reviews.text: I found out from customer service that the ZOOM feature DOESN'T WORK WITH VIEWING BLUE RAYS. They said it was only to do with recording. WHAT!!!! This should have been clear in the advertising, in giant letters. What good is a ZOOM if you can't enlarge 4x3, movies to fill the screen. Otherwise it seems ok, but I gave it only 1 star to alert people. '
customer_reviews.author: S. Gruen

customer_reviews.title: Chokes on DVDs and Blu-Ray discs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2008 after reading many glowing reviews. I have had this player for a year now and am very frustrated at its inability to play discs. It either won't read them when inserted or will freeze in mid-movie. This happens with all discs-DVDs from Netflix (not surprising), my lightly used DVDs (should definitely not happen) and even new Blu-Rays of Madagascar and Up will freeze about 75% of the time. This renders the player nearly useless. My wife hates this player and I have had times where I wanted to trash it a la Office Space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: simplicity
customer_reviews.text: i have a complete system except for the Blu-ray player. .i was not sure so i read review after review for customer experience with different blu-ray players.the panasonic bd35k1080p won out. trust me it will play anything even my personal backups from shrink 3.2 and the quality is excellent and load up is fast.i only paid $269.and i am super pleased. I was one step from buying the Denon bp18oo $400-$600. because my receiver is Denon. now my old collection dvd's are safe with the blu ray.
customer_reviews.author: OrangeCrush6

customer_reviews.title: Note to ONKYO HT-SR800 7.1 Owners
customer_reviews.text: If you own a ONKYO HT-SR800 7.1 then you should consider getting the DMP-BD55K instead of this one. The reason is that the ONKYO does not accept audio through the HDMI cable. Crazy, no? If you really want 7.1 for your system then I'd suggest getting the Panasonic DMP-BD55K which has audio outputs that can go to the ONKYO. Otherwise, for the BD35K you only have optical output which is limited to 5.1 apparently. If anybody has a slicker way of getting around this conundrum, please jump in.
customer_reviews.author: Scratch Duffer

customer_reviews.title: Blu-ray is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite pleased with the Panasonic DMP-BD10AK. That said, if you're now in the market for a high-end Panasonic Blu-ray player, I suggest you wait for the just-announced Panasonic DMP-BD50. The BD10AK is discontinued and it's replacement seems to be the DMP-BD50. The DMP-BD30 looks nice on paper but it seems to be targeting a lower price point (ie. fewer features). I went with the BD10AK because I needed the analog decoding built into the player as I have an older AVR that cannot decode the new higher definition audio formats. With the BD50 now announced, it is best to get that instead.
customer_reviews.author: J. York

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Got this an a Yamaha RX-V863 from Amazon when building my first HTS. Both are still going strong. It was a bit pricy when I got it and newer players are available for less cost. But this one does everything I need it to do so I see no need to replace it. If I do need to do so, I will probable look at a Panasonic unit again base on the performance of this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Oldfart48

customer_reviews.title: This Blu-Ray player is flawless!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this Blu-Ray player for about a year now, and I must say this is truely a perfect Blu-Ray player! The colors, picture quality, and sound are amazing! Watching Blu-Ray movies on it really provides a "pop" for the movie. DVD's also come in very well. I bought the newest Rambo on Blu-Ray and on DVD and I could't tell the difference. I don't know if that's a dis towards the Blu-Ray or a plus for the DVD, but the player is awesome. Go for it and you won't be sorry that you did!!
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP-BD30K Blue Ray
customer_reviews.text: Here's another good DVD/BRay player from Panansonic...I own several other upscaling and DVD-R players from them as well-all have offered great performance, quality and value. No complaints thus far...well perhaps not shipping with a new V1.3 HD cable (no cable included). Great Blu-Ray player, quiet operation, fast loading, easy to operate. Ability to control exterior/unit-face lighting and SD compatibilty a nice plus. Remote not backlit, a bit confusing menu options.
customer_reviews.author: NCstyle

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take some of the work load away from my PS3. Games on the PS3 and movies on this. I have to say that this player is a definite step up. The picture is fantastic and the sound is great. The interface is intuitive and easy to learn. I also like that the player is BDLive compatible and has an ethernet port for firmware upgrades if and when they become available. Would definitely recommend this blu-ray player to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: crb77

customer_reviews.title: I needed to know a little more about it and ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed to know a little more about it and the options others had to make a wiser choice. I thought I was very thorough in my investigating the options.
customer_reviews.author: Rorysdayout

customer_reviews.title: Great picture and sound for a good price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using an OPPO DVD player that upconverts to a pretty nice picture, but with the price of the Panasonic DMP-BD35K Blu-ray player at less that $260, I decided to take the plunge and buy one. What a difference! The picture is amazing on my 106" front projection screen. The difference was so stark, that I decided to upgrade my receiver so I can hear the difference with the TrueHD sound, and I'm glad I did. The detail you can hear in the audio really makes the movie experience special. I don't know if this is the absolute best available for the money, but I know what I like.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dasher

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Blu Ray so I can't compare initial speed/activation but this unit is quick to get ready. The upconversion and sound are excellent. I can "stop" and it holds it's place on the disc which I've read was a problem with older models. Very simple to use, remote works well. If you're looking for a BR player this is a great unit. Amazon's price was outstanding
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: A nice unit for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while now, and it has performed well. No problems, features all work as expected. It just takes a while to boot and eject/start playing DVDs. If you have a Panasonic TV, it also syncs nicely with those.
customer_reviews.author: Russel A. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Great Player
customer_reviews.text: I can concur with previous reviews that this player is exceptional, but the rebate offer of 5 free dvd's is no longer available (unless they've extended it) so keep that in mind when you make your purchase. UPDATE!! After perusing this machine here at Amazon I've noticed They've created a new rebate offer good for purchases through January 31, 2008.
customer_reviews.author: Benny Katz

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PERFORMANCE
customer_reviews.text: Very good performance, easy setup (Viera link) works with Panasonic TV through HDMI connection. You place a DVD in the player and TV turns "On" and switches to DVD input. Loads Blue ray disc fast and efficiently. Highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Hifimiami

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: I'm watching The Last Samurai in Blu Ray. Color and clarity are stunning. Sound is spectacular. Absolutely immerses you in the movie. You have to see it and hear it for yourself. Connected HDMI and digital optical. Upgraded the firmware in 10 minutes with broadband connection. What more can I say? For this price, it's time to jump in!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP-BD35K Blu-ray disc player
customer_reviews.text: I did some research before purchasing this Blu-ray disc player. For the money, this was the best deal. It gives a beautiful 1080p picture on my 52" Sharp Aquos HD screen and the sound can literally shake the room! Start up time is only a few seconds more and it runs off of my single remote Home Theater system. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: topgun

customer_reviews.title: Best Blu-ray Player out.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best Blu-ray currently available. Stay away from Samsung and Sony players. I would recommend this player, but if you need profile 1.1(PiP menu support) or 24p(fps)video input support wait for the new Panason BD30 player that will be availabe very soon. Otherwise this offers the best Picture and Sound quality among the rest of the current players and is one of the fastest loading ones to date.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud9

customer_reviews.title: One of my worst purchases.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't include remote. Doesn't read most blurays anymore. Poor impulse buy hoping for the best.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfectly acceptable basic blue ray player I got a couple years ago. My one complaint is that it takes forever the tray to open once you hit the open button. So its slow at responding but I can deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M. Schreck

customer_reviews.title: Great quality confusing remote
customer_reviews.text: This bluray player works great, the bluray HD quality is incredible, the DVD upscaling is fantastic! It's a teeny bit slow loading the disc, but worth the wait. Drawback: The remote is confusing as all heck! I also dislike the fact that I have to go all the way back to the main menu when I want to turn on closed captioning.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Most folks have covered the basics, so I'll keep this short. The one thing I can add is I bought this player after owning a Sony 300. The Sony Blu-ray player was so slow. I updated the Sony's firmware to the latest version and it was still slow, improved, but slow. I love the Panasonic. The startup time is quicker with Blu-ray discs, as well as standard definition DVDs (regular ol' DVDs.) I paid $429 for the Panasonic, I've seen them for less since. The Blu-ray quality is amazing. I can definitely see the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W. Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Blu-Ray Picture is Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was not planning on getting a blu-ray player, but this came free with the Panasonic TV we ordered on Amazon (at the time). How can you beat that!! Needless to say, we will never go back to regular DVD! We watched Tropic Thunder the other night, the colors were so bright and the picture almost seemed 3-D at times. Had it not been free, I might have considered a player with a few more options (or a PS3), but for a pretty basic player, works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Bikergal18

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Blu ray player
customer_reviews.text: The Panasonic DMP-35K delivers an excellent high def picture that remind me of my old 35mm slides. We are viewing a 46" Samsung LCD TV at a distance of 11 feet. Both the TV and DVD player are set to 1080P. Standard DVDs look so good that we don't feel the need to rent every movie in Blu-Ray.
customer_reviews.author: B. W. Hirn

customer_reviews.title: WOW IT'S GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This blue ray is awesome. I reviewed the different products in my price range and this one stood out. The picture quality is GREAT. I don't have no extravagant sound system and this works with what I have just fine. I LOVE IT. I would not trade it. CDNET was right. This is the editors choice.
customer_reviews.author: Dan323

customer_reviews.title: Whoa!!
customer_reviews.text: Remember the old, "Product specifications are subject to change without notice." Well, they did. Before I bought this, I downloaded the manual to make sure I would have no connection problems. Okay: HDMI to the Panasonic Plasma Display and Digital Coaxial to my Onkyo. When the BD35 arrived, the manual was the same as downloaded, but there simply was no Digital Coaxial Output on the back of the player. None, zero, zip. A quick trip to Radio Shack and a new $27 Optical Cable made everything right with the world. Just a note to prospective buyers, if you need the Digital Coaxial Output, you're in trouble with this unit. Otherwise, I am very pleased so far. TBT Memphis, TN
customer_reviews.author: Grouser Trent

customer_reviews.title: Great player - second time around
customer_reviews.text: My only concern with the Panasonic DMP was that the first unit would not work - the disk tray would not open, even after I tried the troubleshooting guides suggestions on button sequences to overcome this problem. Amazon was great in getting the unit replaced immediately and reimbursing my shipping costs, and the replacement unit works wonderful! What a great picture, even for the old DVDs!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Edwin Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the best Blu-Ray Player on the market. Everything about it is great. The only disappointment is that it did not come with HDMI cables, so I couldn't set it up when it arrived. However, I'd assume this to be true with most players. It's a must have for any home theater.
customer_reviews.author: A. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-Ray
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Blu-ray player; however, knowing nothing about the performance of these, I contacted my brother who is very knowledgable about electronics. He recommended the Panasonic and I was extremely pleased. He set it up for me and am now watching everything on my large screen TV in Blue-ray. Love it and would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann R.

customer_reviews.title: LIVED-UP TO EXCELLENT REVIEWS
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT THE PANASONIC BD35K FROM ITS RAVE REVIEWS AND AM NOT DISAPPOINTED. EASY HOOK-UP WITH MY NEW SAMSUNG 750 TV, FAST RESPONSE TIME WHEN LOADING A DISK AND PICTURE/SOUND ARE GREAT. REMOTE IS QUITE STRAIGHTFORWARD, BUT AT FIRST I WAS A LITTLE INTTIMIDATED OVER MANUAL'S BUSY SET-UP INSTRUCTIONS. AS IT TURNED OUT IT WAS JUST A MATTER OF BEING FAMILIAR WITH BASIC REMOTE BUTTONS, SELECTING THE RIGHT INPUT SOURCE TO THE TV AND INSERTING A DISK. I'LL FIGURE THE MINUTE DETAILS LATER, BUT RIGHT NOW WE'RE ENJOYING CRYSTAL CLEAR MOVIES.
customer_reviews.author: FLYBOY

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Blue Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Blue Ray player... I was concerned with the delay before playing that everyone talks about... The few seconds of delay is well worth the amazing picture. Even if you never bought a blue ray disc, the upcoding of regular DVD is worth the purchase alone!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: first blu ray
customer_reviews.text: Does everything i wanted it for. right now it is just hooked to a tv, no surround. works great, easy to set up and use. later it will be hooked to a panasonic tv. would buy again. also compared prices and this dvd player was $[...] MORE at [...]- just fyi.
customer_reviews.author: vin

customer_reviews.title: Tomco
customer_reviews.text: This blu-ray player is what they say it is. I like the fact that I can use my camera's memory chip to show my pictures on the TV. The video picture (blu-ray or not) is also clear and sharp. It's not hard to operate either. I consider it money "well spent".
customer_reviews.author: Captain Tom

customer_reviews.title: Amazon scores 5 stars along with this Blu-Ray player!
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble with the first Panasonic BD player that Amazon shipped to me. Amazon overnighted the replacement to me and it works great! The picture & sound both are amazing on my 57 inch Mitsubishi 1080 DLP. Thank you Amazon for the excellent service!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works great right out of the box -- didn't even have to read manual. Cables are color coded to the TV I had, so 1 minute to set up and has worked perfectly for one week. Much cheaper than the Sony with similar ratings too. A great buy. AJ
customer_reviews.author: AJ Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of home entertainment with lots of features and realtime firmware updates are automatic- I love ot
customer_reviews.author: Ron Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This unit is easy to set up and it does a very nice job with both Blu Ray discs and standard DVDs. Set up was easy, manual is well written. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lianytsur

customer_reviews.title: Good solid unit
customer_reviews.text: This blu-ray player is basic, but well-built and durable. We've used it for 3-4 years now and the performance has been flawless. Not multi-featured...one disc at a time, but solid.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect Blu-Ray player for me. I am just delving into HT and didn't want to spend a bundle so I did loads of research. CNET et al ranked this as their top Blu-Ray player. And for the price, WOW!! Buy it, you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Shagnat

customer_reviews.title: Blu ray player
customer_reviews.text: This panasonic blu ray player is easy to use and the movies look amazing on our new panasonic flat screen TV....it is MUCH easier to use than our old DVD player...my hucband was able to hook it up with no problems at all..get it, you will love it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hays

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP-BD30K BD Player
customer_reviews.text: Had this BD Player for over a month now and am LOVING it!! Very fast and very quiet. Blu-ray movies look crisp and clear and DVD's look and sound fantastic. Very easy to set up and use. You won't regret buying this one!
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP-BD30K
customer_reviews.text: The Panasonic DMP-BD30K is a great piece of equipment IF you have a cutting edge AV receiver. Video quality is outstanding, the audio capabilities are terrific and upscaling of standard DVDs is impressive. My only problem was in the owners manual and setting-up the player to extract the superb audio requires better documentation. Panasonic should emphasize the on-screen Display during playback and selecting the correct Soundtrack from the Disc menu. Without those steps you'll get average audio playback.
customer_reviews.author: troutbum

customer_reviews.title: One terriffic Player
customer_reviews.text: This player has great upscaling abilities plus intense sound. I gave this one away as a gift for Christmas and will buy myself another one when prices come down. See Cnet for reviews this one takes it all at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: disciple111

customer_reviews.title: Nice Blue-Ray player
customer_reviews.text: This blue-ray player does everything I want it to do and more without an problems. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G.

customer_reviews.title: Great standalone Blu Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: This blu ray player has great HD Quality, espcially considering the price. For a standalone Blu Ray, you can't go wrong with this model. The only other blu ray player out there in the market right now I'd recommend above this one (if you're willing to pay the premium for it) is the PS3... there's plenty of reasons as to why all over the web... but if you're looking for a standalone blu ray player with a nice sleek look to it, great quality, and an affordable price, this model does it.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: CNET Review well deserved.
customer_reviews.text: I chose this blu-ray player based on the review I read on CNET, which spoke of one of the most inexpensive yet capable players on the market. It did not disappoint. Beautiful picture, BD-Live ready (though the people i bought it for dont even use it), and of course on board decoding of all high definition audio codecs. Nothing but praise for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lathan M. Minich

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS FOR A GIFT IT SEEMS LIKE A GOOD BUY
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L. Rochelle

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Blu-ray
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic player with superior imaging. It is a very good looking piece of equipment, and non Blu-ray dvds also look great, to my surprise. I do have this paired with a Panasonic plasma and SA-XR700 receiver, all of which I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Malacoda

customer_reviews.title: great player
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a while at the players out there, but was worried about the load times ad capatability problems between new disks and players. THis one is trouble free and fast; I get my BDs to load in 20 secs consistantly. upgrades are easy via the cd burner on my pc. I am extremely pleased with this player.
customer_reviews.author: HarryHou

customer_reviews.title: Blu-Ray Disk Player
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item and a great price on Amazon's partner. It was delivered timely and we love it. The quality of the DVD's, even the non-Blu-Ray, is incredible!
customer_reviews.author: PGW

customer_reviews.title: Happiness
customer_reviews.text: My panasonic blu-ray arrived quickly and in excellent condition. I like all the features that this model offered and it was easy to set up and use. Would recommend this item to someone looking for an outstanding blu-ray player.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Wachter

customer_reviews.title: Nice Blu Ray
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this player, it makes the movie watching experience very enjoyable. When I bought this in November 2008, Amazon listed the price near $[...]. When I purchased the blu ray player with the 46" Panasonic plasma, there was a $[...] promotion toward the purchase of this--which basically, gave me $[...] back! That made it a very good deal. Of course, this was only the 2nd or 3rd generation of blu ray player out there, so the load time is extremely... slow, which is annoying when you have a 2 year old hanging on every second until the movie begins. I hear the new blu rays load much quicker.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP-BD30K 1080p Blu-Ray Disc Player
customer_reviews.text: This Blu-Ray DVD player brings out the best and most colorful picture I've ever seen from a movie. Played on a 1080P Samsung High Def TV. The shipment from Amazon was recieved in just a couple days and in perfect condition. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray Player
customer_reviews.text: Great product... we have watched several movies and the picture is incredible. Hellboy's make-up was unbelievable. Highly recommend the product and Amazon.com.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Panasonic DMP-BD35K 1080p Blu-ray Player is absolutely great with clear crisp bluray picture quality. Money well spent. But it seems like it doesn't support the old VCD format. Actually my normal philips DVD player plays the VCD's. But I'm not sure if thats the problem with the player or the disc itself. However I dont think anyone cares for VCD's anymore in this generation. All-in-all a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dileep Varma Penmetsa

customer_reviews.title: Best buy on Blu-ray
customer_reviews.text: Researched this product thoroughly, and without a doubt this was THE best price around. Great deal and fantastic Christmas gift for my husband. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Barb P

customer_reviews.title: Quality BD player
customer_reviews.text: This blu ray player does everything it's suppose to. Beautiful picture. I bought it to go with my Denon 3808, which handles all the up conversions and other things a more expensive player is designed to do. I don't need ethernet. All I want to do is watch great movies with a great picture: 1080p. The Panasonic BD 30 does it well.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Brockbank

customer_reviews.title: Good Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: I've had this player for about 2 months. Bought it for a great deal on Amazon. Excellent picture quality, set up was easy. For around $200, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: T. H.

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed to do well.
customer_reviews.text: Great picture! Thats all that matters to me. It also turns on and off automatically with my TV which is the only other feature I use.
customer_reviews.author: Mpower

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations . . .
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the performance. Firmware upgrade through the web was seamless. There were many positive reviews on this model and it exceeded my expectations. I have purchased a number of Panasonic products over the years and have always been pleased with their features and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Slow Booting
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Blu-ray player but very low booting up and loading dvd/blu-ray discs. Excellent picture and sound quality!
customer_reviews.author: R. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful picture!
customer_reviews.text: This is a gread Blu-Ray player. I've owned it for several months now and I'm very happy with it! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lisanti

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It's no good, would like to return it for a full refund
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Design And Superb Picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: A Beautiful Blu-ray Player, In Both Style and Picture Quality, I Wish More Companies Made More Like This. I Hate Many Of The New Blu-ray Players of Today, Too Boring And Simple, Some not all. This Panasonic Player, Is Wonderful..At A Great Buy and Price.
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH MARTINEZ

customer_reviews.title: nice player
customer_reviews.text: very nice blu-ray player, the picture on my 720p TV is excellent and the sound is better than that produced by an older (one year) Sony DVD player. Standard DVD's also had a picture improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Blue Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: I love not only the way my movies look played on via the Blue-Ray format but also the increased sound quality, it really is worth the extra cost!! However, I'm not pleased with the company I purchased it thru and would never use it again, especially because I never received any response at all to the email that I sent them per Amazon's suggestion.
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Doser

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Blu-ray Player
customer_reviews.text: Easy to connect and set up. Takes average time for movie to load but the end result is fantastic picture and sound.
customer_reviews.author: Walt P

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Blu_Ray Player DMP-BD35K
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Blu Ray player for a good price. We were very pleased with the video and audio quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dal - S.F. Fan

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the quality for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent video quality, good upscaling, nice slim design, decent load times, for the price you can't beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Rich, L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Blu-ray Player
customer_reviews.text: I've had this player for a month and we love it. No problem. It is a little slow loading the disk, but averything else is soooo good. We had some friends over last week with their report on their trip to Italy. We watched their home made still and movie pictures on CD with nno problems. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great BD player, great price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this BD player 11/28/08 from Amazon at a price much below MSRP. It delivers excellent picture and sound. I recently found out that Panasonic has discontinued this model. That is too bad for anyone wanting an excellent player and a good price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Schuman

customer_reviews.title: Great player
customer_reviews.text: This is my first blu-ray player and I am very happy with it. I went by the reviews here and the CET review and it turned out to be a good choice. I have seen the Sylvania one available for $178 at Costco and the Panasosonic player is much lighter and prettier. Did not do a close comparison of picture quality between the two. However, I recall that the Sylvania one was short on some audio connectors compared to this one. If you just intend to use the HDMI cable for audio output it may not be a factor.
customer_reviews.author: Pawan Kumar

customer_reviews.title: magical!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great player. The picture is wonderful from all sources I have yet tried - even the SD slot for the camera card was WAY better than expected. I'm using the analogue audio outputs and the sound is better than the now defunct DVD Audio or SACD, to my ears. Still can't belive the tech you can buy with a paltry $ 325! Wow.
customer_reviews.author: Keith M. Ottman

customer_reviews.title: Panasoic 30 Blu Ray DVD player
customer_reviews.text: The unit was easy to integrate into Home theater. The video and sound are great. What I also like is the ability to plug in my camera SD chip and see the pictures in high resolution. Great for slide show presentation of your vacation / reunion etc. and you can also have background music from a CD if you use the SD chip for the slide show. GREAT SYSTEM.
customer_reviews.author: H. Waruszewski

customer_reviews.title: Fine Choice for Blu-ray
customer_reviews.text: Chose this brand/model because of the great reviews from other folks. It replaced my "upgrader" DVD player, and does indeed reproduce a better image on any DVD movie. Blu-ray looks phenomenal on my Samsung LCD HDTV.
customer_reviews.author: MN Online

customer_reviews.title: Best Blu Ray On The market for The Money
customer_reviews.text: This Player is Excellent In Everyway. Not Much more I can Say About it. I Paid Only 189.00 Including Shipping and NO Sales Tax. It Works Perfect Even The up Conversion works great Also. I Burn My Own Movies Not Blurays Yet. Have The Program To do Blurays not The Writer. Waiting for The Price To come down even further.
customer_reviews.author: David S. Bernstein

customer_reviews.title: Agree with other reviews- great
customer_reviews.text: Played as expected based on reviews from Amazon and Cnet.com. Great product, still a bit on the expensive side
customer_reviews.author: Keith E.

customer_reviews.title: "A great player for the price!"
customer_reviews.text: Picture and sound quality are very good. Very easy to use and I couldn't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: David P.

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE BEST STAND ALONE BLU RAY PLAYER OUT THERE....AWESOME PICTURE AND AWESOME SOUND.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN B.

customer_reviews.title: Great player at very good price
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this unit because I can view my HD video from my Canon HF10 on SD card direct, and watch blue-ray movie on my 46 inch LCD, the unit is much fast than SONY, from insert media to movie start less than 30 second. SD card view also quick and true 1080P resloution.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent image, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Made my choice on this product over a SONY model. First time set up is really easy -- plug in and change a few on-screen menu items, that's it! Only the audio part took another try to output Dolby 5.1. Test the machine on BBC's Planet Earth, really crisp images and vivid colors.
customer_reviews.author: YS12345678

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP-BD10AK 1080p Blu-ray Disc Player
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is great. I'm not sure if it is designed that way but it makes a clunking sound when ejecting the disc.
customer_reviews.author: Monty

customer_reviews.title: Handling of item return by Amazon and the 3rd party vendo
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after purchasing a Panasonic Blu Ray player it became clear to me that it was a wrong selection because of my setup. I communicated a desire to return it unopened to the vendor (6th Ave. Electronics) thru Amazon. Both companies were helpful and communicated promptly. While I haven't recieved the refund as yet, I am sure from the experience so far that it will go smoothly. Wonderful service by both.
customer_reviews.author: MSS

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Blue Ray BD 35K
customer_reviews.text: Excellent 1080p blue ray picture on my 52" Samsung 650 series LCD TV! Upconversion of standard DVD is very good however do see some picture and color distortion intermittently but not too frequent. Excellent unit at the $225 price Amazon was selling it for.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great all-around player
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a player for BD,DVD and other media and this one does it all. The price was quite modist. It shows off my HD tv.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Steiner

customer_reviews.title: It's a Panasonic!!
customer_reviews.text: No since in bragging much about it. It's a panasonic. I don't care what you review, panasonic and samsung are the best video equipment around in my opinion and this player has everything you will need in a Blu-Ray player at least for the next 5 years probably. A little pricey though considering others but 99% of the time you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: One of the best that I have seen.
customer_reviews.text: This Blue Ray player is fairly fast and has excellent Picture and sound. It does an excellent job of playing home recorded DVDs and CDs. I do find the manual not very helpful and not well writin.
customer_reviews.author: John K. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP-BD35K
customer_reviews.text: Very happy..couldn't ask for a better player.have everything hooked up HDMI on a Denon 789.Kicks butt...
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great Bargan!
customer_reviews.text: Works well right out of the box, and talks to my other Panasonic VIERA equipment via HDMI cable. And, I saved at least a hundred dollars!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur W. Juntunen

customer_reviews.title: Great upconverting dvd player!
customer_reviews.text: If you are not convinced about this dvd player upconverting you old dvds, try it and you won't regret it! It works great with Panasonic plasma 42" 1080p!
customer_reviews.author: George Cozac

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this Blu-ray player. It works great and has outstanding picture and sound quality. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: F. Brayton

product_meta.title: Panasonic DMP-BD30K 1080p Blu-Ray Disc Player
product_meta.description:
Style:DMP-BD30KBlu-ray means incredible full-HD images, breathtaking sound and 5x the data capacity of DVDs. Now Blu-ray means something else too: an entirely new movie-viewing experience, made possible by Final Standard Profile, which adds features never seen before, like four Picture-in-Picture modes including Enhanced Commentary (from directors and actors), Backstage Pass, Peek Behind the Animation and Audio Mixing. Combining a PHL Reference Chroma Processor with advanced P4HD (Pixel Precision Progressive Processing) imaging technology, UniPhier(R) — the Precise Digital Video processor — reproduces crisp, natural colors that are extremely faithful to the original movie. It does this by up-sampling the color information in decoded video signals, while the super high-speed P4HD up-converts content recorded in 480i/p, 720p or 1080i format to 1080p by correctly generating each pixel according to information drawn from up to 60 surrounding pixels. The image motion of each pixel is then categorized into one of 16 levels, from stationary to super fast. Image quality is further enhanced by Diagonal Processing, which creates smooth, sharp diagonal lines, and 3:2 Pull-Down, which optimizes the processing accordingly for film or video making the images look natural and lifelike. In addition, the DMP-BD30's HDMI output is Deep Color compatible, with 4,096 steps of gradation for even smoother, finer-quality images that meet Hollywood's stringent demands, so you can experience movies just the way they were meant to be experienced. With Precise Digital Audio, Blu-ray's beautiful images are complemented by exceptionally pure, accurate sound thanks to Dolby(R) TrueHD and DTS-HD(TM). UniPhier(R)'s advanced processing capability decodes these audio signals with high precision and outputs them in bitstream form with no degradation. It also brings re-mastering to Blu-ray for the first time, which compensates for data lost during the compression process creating a fuller, richer sound.

AMAZON.COM
Blu-ray means incredible full-HD images, breathtaking sound and 5x the data capacity of DVDs. Now Blu-ray means something else too: an entirely new movie-viewing experience, made possible by Final Standard Profile, which adds features never seen before, like four Picture-in-Picture modes including Enhanced Commentary (from directors and actors), Backstage Pass, Peek Behind the Animation and Audio Mixing. 

 Images So Real, You Feel Like You're in the Picture
Combining a PHL Reference Chroma Processor with advanced P4HD (Pixel Precision Progressive Processing) imaging technology, UniPhier — the Precise Digital Video processor — reproduces crisp, natural colors that are extremely faithful to the original movie. It does this by up-sampling the color information in decoded video signals, while the super high-speed P4HD up-converts content recorded in 480i/p, 720p or 1080i format to 1080p by correctly generating each pixel according to information drawn from up to 60 surrounding pixels. The image motion of each pixel is then categorized into one of 16 levels, from stationary to super fast. Image quality is further enhanced by Diagonal Processing, which creates smooth, sharp diagonal lines, and 3:2 Pull-Down, which optimizes the processing accordingly for film or video making the images look natural and lifelike. In addition, the DMP-BD30's HDMI output is Deep Color compatible, with 4,096 steps of gradation for even smoother, finer-quality images that meet Hollywood's stringent demands, so you can experience movies just the way they were meant to be experienced. 

 Incredible Sound Completes the Hi-Def Experience
With Precise Digital Audio, Blu-ray's beautiful images are complemented by exceptionally pure, accurate sound thanks to Dolby TrueHD and DTS-HD. UniPhier's advanced processing capability decodes these audio signals with high precision and outputs them in bitstream form with no degradation. It also brings re-mastering to Blu-ray for the first time, which compensates for data lost during the compression process creating a fuller, richer sound. 

 HD Networking with SD Card
The convenient SD card slot on the DMP-BD30 allows easy viewing of hi-def videos and photos on your HDTV. Videos shot with a Panasonic HD camcorder are output in their original 1920x1080 resolution, while still images taken with a Panasonic Lumix digital camera are up-converted and output in 1920x1080 resolution1. 

 One-Touch Control from Your TV's Remote
With EZ Sync HDAVI Control, you can control your Blu-ray Disc player — and all your home theater components — with your TV's remote2. Simply press the EZ Sync button and select "BD Player" on the menu screen; the BD player's menu will be displayed and you can begin playback.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Blu-ray with a Difference
Blu-ray means incredible full-HD images, breathtaking sound and 5x the data capacity of DVDs. Now Blu-ray means something else too: an entirely new movie-viewing experience, made possible by Final Standard Profile, which adds features never seen before, like four Picture-in-Picture modes including Enhanced Commentary (from directors and actors), Backstage Pass, Peek Behind the Animation and Audio Mixing.

Images So Real, You Feel Like You're in the Picture
Combining a PHL Reference Chroma Processor with advanced P4HD (Pixel Precision Progressive Processing) imaging technology, UniPhier — the Precise Digital Video processor — reproduces crisp, natural colors that are extremely faithful to the original movie. It does this by up-sampling the color information in decoded video signals, while the super high-speed P4HD up-converts content recorded in 480i/p, 720p or 1080i format to 1080p by correctly generating each pixel according to information drawn from up to 60 surrounding pixels. The image motion of each pixel is then categorized into one of 16 levels, from stationary to super fast. Image quality is further enhanced by Diagonal Processing, which creates smooth, sharp diagonal lines, and 3:2 Pull-Down, which optimizes the processing accordingly for film or video making the images look natural and lifelike. In addition, the DMP-BD30's HDMI output is Deep Color compatible, with 4,096 steps of gradation for even smoother, finer-quality images that meet Hollywood's stringent demands, so you can experience movies just the way they were meant to be experienced.

Incredible Sound Completes the Hi-Def Experience
With Precise Digital Audio, Blu-ray's beautiful images are complemented by exceptionally pure, accurate sound thanks to Dolby TrueHD and DTS-HD. UniPhier's advanced processing capability decodes these audio signals with high precision and outputs them in bitstream form with no degradation. It also brings re-mastering to Blu-ray for the first time, which compensates for data lost during the compression process creating a fuller, richer sound.

HD Networking with SD Card
The convenient SD card slot on the DMP-BD30 allows easy viewing of hi-def videos and photos on your HDTV. Videos shot with a Panasonic HD camcorder are output in their original 1920x1080 resolution, while still images taken with a Panasonic Lumix digital camera are up-converted and output in 1920x1080 resolution1.

One-Touch Control from Your TV's Remote
With EZ Sync HDAVI Control, you can control your Blu-ray Disc player — and all your home theater components — with your TV's remote2. Simply press the EZ Sync button and select "BD Player" on the menu screen; the BD player's menu will be displayed and you can begin playback.


NOTES

 1. JPEG and other still image sources converted to 1920x1080 resolution, while of high quality, will exhibit somwehat lower subjective image resolution than true, native 1080p full-HD sources.
 2. This function is available for 2007 Panasonic home theater systems used with 2007 Panasonic flat-panel TV models.

Audio S/N 115dB Dynamic Range 100dB Power Source AC 120V, 60Hz Power Consumption 25W (approx) Dimensions (H x W x D) 2 5/16 inches x 16 15/16 inches x 12 5/8 inches Weight 7.3 lbs FOOTNOTES
 1. Discs recorded and finalized on DVD video recorders/cameras.
 2. Playability may vary depending on the contents, discs and quality of the recording.
 3. MP3 audio decoding technology licensed from Fraunhofer IIS and Thomson multimedia. For contents recorded on CD-R/RW media from CDs for your personal use. Playability may vary depending on contents and discs.
 4. Availability of 1080p video sources is currently limited to sources such as Panasonic Blu-ray Disc players. HDMI connection may be required.
